attributes.additional_details:
It is very unfair that if one member of the couple earns more then £50.099/year, we have to pay tax on the child benefit even if the other member only earns £10.000/annum!
But if both members earn £49.999, so almost £100.000/year in total, the higher earner tax on the child benefit is not applicable!
attributes.background: Instead of taking into account the earnings of one member of the household for the child benefit, calculate on household income.
